snippet: Overturning the exemption and requiring that pharmaceutical companies pay their representatives overtime could cost the companies billions of dollars in liabilities.
abstract: Supreme Court considers whether representatives of pharmaceutical companies who visit doctors' offices to promote their companies' products are entitled to overtime; answer turns on whether those visits are sales calls or something else; defendant in case is GlaxoSmithKline; overturning the exemption and requiring that drug firms pay their representatives overtime could cost the companies billions of dollars in liabilities.
lead_paragraph: Overturning the exemption and requiring that pharmaceutical companies pay their representatives overtime could cost the companies billions of dollars in liabilities.
